Hi, @complone, sorry i don't understand your means, above code shows that it will notify routers the rules have changed, but I read the latest code, it does't use the `isRuntime` method.

The most important is that `isRuntime` method indicates that if `route` method should be invoke everytime before a request is sended, it's a problem if i have heavy operating in `route` method.

And more, I custom my router by `SPI`, and use `@Activate` annotation on it, it's a necessity in my job, so I don't need to care if the rule is changed.

@complone I think your solution is not right, because the zookeeper transporter is not only used by config-center. It will not use "config.timeout" as timeout key when it is used by Zookeeper Registry.
知道了，我猜这里的MD5生成了16字节，而hash换的key只要4个字节，所以一次md5可以用在四个节点，除非碰巧其中有两个一样。

> @complone I think your solution is not right, because the zookeeper transporter is not only used by config-center. It will not use "config.timeout" as timeout key when it is used by Zookeeper Registry.

So what do I do right?I followed the ‘dubbo-samples/dubbo-samples-annotation’ and reported the error. My configuration file is as follows:
![10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7754030/62614894-dd189f00-b93e-11e9-97ea-bf3c10398478.png)
![11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7754030/62614896-ddb13580-b93e-11e9-96bf-7d15ad31299e.png)
![12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7754030/62614897-de49cc00-b93e-11e9-8a58-b5f9ed759952.png)

It is divided into the following two steps:

- Generate a message digest for every 4 nodes according to the md5 algorithm. The digest is 16 bytes and 128 bits long.
- Then divide 128 bits into 4 parts, 0-31, 32-63, 64-95, 95-128, and generate 4 32-bit numbers, stored in long, the high 32 bits of long are 0 and as the key of the virtual node.

> @complone I think your solution is not right, because the zookeeper transporter is not only used by config-center. It will not use "config.timeout" as timeout key when it is used by Zookeeper Registry.

This pr can solve the problem, but I found the code is confusing.
If we use direct invoke, usually the direct link url doesn't have parameters(because we can define parameters in reference directly. So the remoteUrl in ClusterUtils.mergeUrl method is empty. So it doesn't have group and version key.

If we don't use direct invoke, and either group or version of ReferenceConfig and ServiceConfig is different, it will not go into the ClusterUtils.merge method.

Maybe we can split the ClusterUtils.merge method into two methods, one is used by direct invoke. The other is used by the indirect invoke.

I read the code ZookeeperRegistry.toUrlsWithEmpty, I found 
- if the ”group“ or” version“ is mismatching，the url will not be passed to next process.
- so when invoke the RegistryDirectory.toInvokers, the group or version is always equel between ReferenceConfig and ServiceConfig.
- then the method "ClusterUtils.merge()" merge the provider's "gourp" or "version" value and consumer's "gourp" or "version" value  is redundant.

So I think , when provider does not have "group" or "version" (generally direct invoke) ，then do not remove "group" or "version" key from local map，it can meet both direct invoke and from registry.
